column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////I got the Tonkotsu black #1 and it was terrific. Comparing this to Ramen Tatsuya back in Austin
column2: they both have their pros and cons. Tatsuya pork was more seared and melted in your mouth
column3: it was one of my favorite parts of Tatsuya. The meat here was tender
column4: but not as flavorful and no seat or color ok the meat. The soup here trumps Tatsuya slightly. I think the soup at Tatsuya leaves me very thirsty afterwards
column5: but this soup was flavorful with heavy pork flavors yet still light.
